Tumor Heterogeneity Analysis

Intra-tumor Heterogeneity (ITH) Characterization

Comprehensive analysis of genetic diversity within tumors to understand clonal evolution, subclonal populations, and therapeutic resistance mechanisms.

Key Capabilities

  • Clonal Evolution Analysis: Identify clonal and subclonal mutations to map tumor evolutionary trajectories
  • Subclonal Population Detection: Detect distinct cellular populations through branching evolutionary patterns
  • Variant Calling: Comprehensive somatic variant detection including SNVs, indels, and structural variants
  • Mutational Signature Analysis: Characterize mutational processes driving tumor heterogeneity
  • Temporal Evolution: Track clonal dynamics and selective pressures over time

Scientific Background

Clinical Significance: ITH provides genetic variation that drives cancer progression and drug resistance. Studies across 2,658 cancer genomes show that 95% of tumors contain distinct subclonal expansions with branching relationships, making ITH analysis crucial for precision oncology.

Input Requirements

  • Format: CSV or TSV samplesheet
  • Data Types: WGS, WTS, or targeted/panel sequencing
  • Sample Types: Paired tumor/normal or tumor-only
Workflow Features:
Automated processing pipeline with quality control, comprehensive variant analysis, clonal deconvolution, and detailed reporting for clinical applications in precision oncology.
